dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 794 IH: Ending Mandates on Head Start Educators Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Joyce of Ohio (for himself, Mrs. Miller-Meeks, Mr. Moolenaar, and Mr. Rutherford) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and the Workforce

form.official-title: To eliminate the COVID–19 vaccine and mask requirement in Head Start Programs.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Ending Mandates on Head Start Educators Act.

section.header: Eliminating the COVID–19 vaccine and mask requirement in Head Start Programs
section.text: The Secretary of Health and Human Services may not implement, enforce, or otherwise give effect to the rule entitled Vaccine and Mask Requirements To Mitigate the Spread of COVID–19 in Head Start Programs published by the Department of Health and Human Services on November 30, 2021 (86 Fed. Reg. 68052), and may not promulgate any substantially similar rule.
